definition: (coll.) promising/likely to turn out well
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
trick/drama/play/show/CL:齣|出[chu1],場|场[chang3],臺|台[tai2]

sentences.english: Bart really cleaned up in the card game.
sentences.chinese: 巴特在紙牌有戲中大獲全勝。

sentences.english: Are there not mockers with me? and doth not mine eye continue in their provocation?
sentences.chinese: 真有戲笑我的在我這裏，我眼常見他們惹動我。

sentences.english: I thought you two were becoming an item.
EFS Key is gathering required information from Master File Table. This could take some time.
sentences.chinese: 看來有戲，正在收集信息分析加密過的文件。

sentences.english: With the additional of contrast, shadow, colors, a simple matchstick man can be very dramatic.
sentences.chinese: 加上了光影，色彩，簡單的火柴人就變得很有戲了。

sentences.english: The next millionaire seemed more promising.
sentences.chinese: 接下來這個富豪，看上去有戲。
傑尼斯肯斯立馬知道搜尋有戲了。
